access_logs.description:
Provisions an S3 bucket with built in IAM policy to allow [AWS Load Balancers](https://aws.amazon.com/documentation/elastic-load-balancing/) to ship [access logs](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/elasticloadbalancing/latest/application/load-balancer-access-logs.html) Builds the resources(s) from terraform-aws-lb-s3-bucket/0.16.4 This is done by adding a declaration for the desired asset in ../config/infrastructure/access_logs.yaml. Each parameter may or may not contain any of the following:
Default
Either a default value or a generator used to produce a default value using Terraform
Override
A value or generator that always overrides any value set
Required
Whether the parameter must be set or not
Type
The type of the parameter as dictated by Terraform's types and values documentation
Use the parameters to construct the specification for your asset.

sections.description: Name of the S3 bucket where S3 access logs will be sent to
sections.title: access_log_bucket_name

sections.description: Prefix to prepend to the current S3 bucket name, where S3 access logs will be sent to
sections.title: access_log_bucket_prefix

sections.description: Account ID for the module instance
sections.title: account_id

sections.description: AWS accounts where the module instance will be built
sections.title: accounts

sections.description: Canned ACL to apply to the S3 bucket
sections.title: acl

sections.description:
Additional key-value pairs to add to each map in `tags_as_list_of_maps`.

Not added to `tags` or `id`.

This is for some rare cases where resources want additional configuration of tags

and therefore take a list of maps with tag key, value, and additional configuration.
sections.title: additional_tag_map

sections.description: Require requests to use Secure Socket Layer (HTTPS/SSL).
sections.title: allow_ssl_requests_only

sections.description:
ID element.

Additional attributes (e.g. `workers` or `cluster`) to add to `id`,

in the order they appear in the list.

New attributes are appended to the

end of the list.

The elements of the list are joined by the `delimiter`

and treated as a single ID element.
sections.title: attributes

sections.description:
Bucket name.

If provided, the bucket will be created with this name instead of generating the name from the context
sections.title: bucket_name

sections.description:
Delimiter to be used between ID elements.

Defaults to `-` (hyphen).

Set to `""` to use no delimiter at all.
sections.title: delimiter

sections.description: Describe additional descriptors to be output in the `descriptors` output map. Map of maps. Keys are names of descriptors. Values are maps of the form { format = string labels = list(string) } (Type is `any` so the map values can later be enhanced to provide additional options.) `format` is a Terraform format string to be passed to the `format()` function. `labels` is a list of labels, in order, to pass to `format()` function. Label values will be normalized before being passed to `format()` so they will be identical to how they appear in `id`. Default is {} (`descriptors` output will be empty).
sections.title: descriptor_formats

sections.description: Set to false to prevent the module from creating any resources
sections.title: enabled

sections.description:
ID element.

Usually used for region e.g. 'uw2', 'us-west-2', OR role 'prod', 'staging', 'dev', 'UAT'
sections.title: environment

sections.description: Execution role ARN for the module instance
sections.title: execution_role_arn

sections.description:
When `true`, permits a non-empty S3 bucket to be deleted by first deleting all objects in the bucket.

THESE OBJECTS ARE NOT RECOVERABLE even if they were versioned and stored in Glacier.

Must be set `false` unless `force_destroy_enabled` is also `true`.
sections.title: force_destroy

sections.description:
Limit `id` to this many characters (minimum 6).

Set to `0` for unlimited length.

Set to `null` for keep the existing setting, which defaults to `0`.

Does not affect `id_full`.
sections.title: id_length_limit

sections.description:
The order in which the labels (ID elements) appear in the `id`.

Defaults to ["namespace", "environment", "stage", "name", "attributes"].

You can omit any of the 6 labels ("tenant" is the 6th), but at least one must be present.
sections.title: label_order

sections.description:
A list of S3 bucket v2 lifecycle rules, as specified in [terraform-aws-s3-bucket](https://github.com/cloudposse/terraform-aws-s3-bucket)"

These rules are not affected by the deprecated `lifecycle_rule_enabled` flag.

**NOTE:** Unless you also set `lifecycle_rule_enabled = false` you will also get the default deprecated rules set on your bucket.

snippets.content:
optional(list(object({
enabled = optional(bool)
id = optional(string)
abort_incomplete_multipart_upload_days = optional(number)
filter_and = optional(any)
expiration = optional(any)
transition = optional(list(any))
noncurrent_version_expiration = optional(any)
noncurrent_version_transition = optional(list(any))
})))
snippets.title: Type

sections.title: lifecycle_configuration_rules

sections.description:
ID element.

Usually the component or solution name, e.g. 'app' or 'jenkins'.

This is the only ID element not also included as a `tag`.

The "name" tag is set to the full `id` string.

There is no tag with the value of the `name` input.
sections.title: name

sections.description:
ID element.

Usually an abbreviation of your organization name, e.g. 'eg' or 'cp', to help ensure generated IDs are globally unique
sections.title: namespace

sections.description:
Optional map of accounts to a corresponding spoke VPC network name within the account.

Use the network name from the Transit Gateway, not the VPC name itself, e.g. cluster_Clusters_Prod.
sections.title: network_map

sections.description: Whether to build an instance of the module for private Intranet access
sections.title: private

sections.description: Whether to build an instance of the module for public Internet access
sections.title: public

sections.description:
Terraform regular expression (regex) string.

Characters matching the regex will be removed from the ID elements.

If not set, `"/[^a-zA-Z0-9-]/"` is used to remove all characters other than hyphens, letters and digits.
sections.title: regex_replace_chars

sections.description:
ID element.

Usually used to indicate role, e.g. 'prod', 'staging', 'source', 'build', 'test', 'deploy', 'release'
sections.title: stage

sections.description: Additional tags (e.g. {'BusinessUnit': 'XYZ'}). Neither the tag keys nor the tag values will be modified by this module.

snippets.content: { for k, v in merge(local.tags, lookup(|DATA_SINK|, "tags", {})) : k => v if k != "Name" }
snippets.title: Override

sections.title: tags

sections.description:
ID element _(Rarely used, not included by default)_.

A customer identifier, indicating who this instance of a resource is for
sections.title: tenant

sections.description: Enable object versioning, keeping multiple variants of an object in the same bucket
sections.title: versioning_enabled

access_logs.title: Configuration

efs_filesystems.description:
Terraform module to provision an AWS EFS Network File System. Builds the resources(s) from terraform-aws-efs/0.33.0 This is done by adding a declaration for the desired asset in ../config/infrastructure/efs_filesystems.yaml. Each parameter may or may not contain any of the following:
Default
Either a default value or a generator used to produce a default value using Terraform
Override
A value or generator that always overrides any value set
Required
Whether the parameter must be set or not
Type
The type of the parameter as dictated by Terraform's types and values documentation
Use the parameters to construct the specification for your asset.

sections.description:
A map of the access points you would like in your EFS volume



    See [examples/complete] for an example on how to set this up.

    All keys are strings.

The primary keys are the names of access points.

    The secondary keys are `posix_user` and `creation_info`.

    The secondary_gids key should be a comma separated value.

    More information can be found in the terraform resource [efs_access_point](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/hashicorp/aws/latest/docs/resources/efs_access_point).
sections.title: access_points

sections.description: Account ID for the module instance
sections.title: account_id

sections.description: AWS accounts where the module instance will be built
sections.title: accounts

sections.description:
A list of Security Group rule objects to add to the created security group, in addition to the ones

this module normally creates.

(To suppress the module's rules, set `create_security_group` to false

and supply your own security group via `associated_security_group_ids`.)

The keys and values of the objects are fully compatible with the `aws_security_group_rule` resource, except

for `security_group_id` which will be ignored, and the optional "key" which, if provided, must be unique and known at "plan" time.

To get more info see https://registry.terraform.io/providers/hashicorp/aws/latest/docs/resources/security_group_rule .
sections.title: additional_security_group_rules

sections.description:
Additional key-value pairs to add to each map in `tags_as_list_of_maps`.

Not added to `tags` or `id`.

This is for some rare cases where resources want additional configuration of tags

and therefore take a list of maps with tag key, value, and additional configuration.
sections.title: additional_tag_map

sections.description: The CIDR blocks from which to allow `ingress` traffic to the EFS
sections.title: allowed_cidr_blocks

sections.description: A list of IDs of Security Groups to allow access to the security group created by this module.
sections.title: allowed_security_group_ids

sections.description:
A list of IDs of Security Groups to associate the EFS Mount Targets with, in addition to the created security group.

These security groups will not be modified and, if `create_security_group` is `false`, must have rules providing the desired access.
sections.title: associated_security_group_ids

sections.description:
ID element.

Additional attributes (e.g. `workers` or `cluster`) to add to `id`,

in the order they appear in the list.

New attributes are appended to the

end of the list.

The elements of the list are joined by the `delimiter`

and treated as a single ID element.
sections.title: attributes

sections.description:
AWS Availability Zone in which to create the file system.

Used to create a file system that uses One Zone storage classes.

If set, a single subnet in the same availability zone should be provided to `subnets`
sections.title: availability_zone_name

sections.description:
Set `true` to create and configure a new security group.

If false, `associated_security_group_ids` must be provided.
sections.title: create_security_group

sections.description:
Delimiter to be used between ID elements.

Defaults to `-` (hyphen).

Set to `""` to use no delimiter at all.
sections.title: delimiter

sections.description: Describe additional descriptors to be output in the `descriptors` output map. Map of maps. Keys are names of descriptors. Values are maps of the form { format = string labels = list(string) } (Type is `any` so the map values can later be enhanced to provide additional options.) `format` is a Terraform format string to be passed to the `format()` function. `labels` is a list of labels, in order, to pass to `format()` function. Label values will be normalized before being passed to `format()` so they will be identical to how they appear in `id`. Default is {} (`descriptors` output will be empty).
sections.title: descriptor_formats

sections.description: Name of the CNAME record to create
sections.title: dns_name

sections.description: If `true`, it will turn on automatic backups.
sections.title: efs_backup_policy_enabled

sections.description: Whether to enable an EFS cross-account policy
sections.title: efs_cross_account_policy_enabled

sections.description: Set to false to prevent the module from creating any resources
sections.title: enabled

sections.description: If true, the file system will be encrypted
sections.title: encrypted

sections.description:
ID element.

Usually used for region e.g. 'uw2', 'us-west-2', OR role 'prod', 'staging', 'dev', 'UAT'
sections.title: environment

sections.description: Execution role ARN for the module instance
sections.title: execution_role_arn

sections.description:
Limit `id` to this many characters (minimum 6).

Set to `0` for unlimited length.

Set to `null` for keep the existing setting, which defaults to `0`.

Does not affect `id_full`.
sections.title: id_length_limit

sections.description: If set, use a specific KMS key
sections.title: kms_key_id

sections.description:
The order in which the labels (ID elements) appear in the `id`.

Defaults to ["namespace", "environment", "stage", "name", "attributes"].

You can omit any of the 6 labels ("tenant" is the 6th), but at least one must be present.
sections.title: label_order

sections.description: The address (within the address range of the specified subnet) at which the file system may be mounted via the mount target
sections.title: mount_target_ip_address

sections.description:
ID element.

Usually the component or solution name, e.g. 'app' or 'jenkins'.

This is the only ID element not also included as a `tag`.

The "name" tag is set to the full `id` string.

There is no tag with the value of the `name` input.
sections.title: name

sections.description:
ID element.

Usually an abbreviation of your organization name, e.g. 'eg' or 'cp', to help ensure generated IDs are globally unique
sections.title: namespace

sections.description:
Optional map of accounts to a corresponding spoke VPC network name within the account.

Use the network name from the Transit Gateway, not the VPC name itself, e.g. cluster_Clusters_Prod.
sections.title: network_map

sections.description:
The file system performance mode.

Can be either `generalPurpose` or `maxIO`
sections.title: performance_mode

sections.description: Whether to build an instance of the module for private Intranet access
sections.title: private

sections.description:
The throughput, measured in MiB/s, that you want to provision for the file system.

Only applicable with `throughput_mode` set to provisioned
sections.title: provisioned_throughput_in_mibps

sections.description: Whether to build an instance of the module for public Internet access
sections.title: public

sections.description:
Terraform regular expression (regex) string.

Characters matching the regex will be removed from the ID elements.

If not set, `"/[^a-zA-Z0-9-]/"` is used to remove all characters other than hyphens, letters and digits.
sections.title: regex_replace_chars

sections.description: AWS Region
sections.title: region

sections.description:
Set `true` to enable Terraform `create_before_destroy` behavior on the created security group.

Note that changing this value will always cause the security group to be replaced.
sections.title: security_group_create_before_destroy

sections.description: How long to wait for the security group to be created.
sections.title: security_group_create_timeout

sections.description:
How long to retry on `DependencyViolation` errors during security group deletion from

lingering ENIs left by certain AWS services such as Elastic Load Balancing.
sections.title: security_group_delete_timeout

sections.description:
The description to assign to the created Security Group.

Warning: Changing the description causes the security group to be replaced.
sections.title: security_group_description

sections.description:
The name to assign to the created security group.

Must be unique within the VPC.

If not provided, will be derived from the `null-label.context` passed in.

If `create_before_destroy` is true, will be used as a name prefix.
sections.title: security_group_name

sections.description:
ID element.

Usually used to indicate role, e.g. 'prod', 'staging', 'source', 'build', 'test', 'deploy', 'release'
sections.title: stage

sections.description: Subnet IDs
sections.title: subnets

sections.description: Additional tags (e.g. {'BusinessUnit': 'XYZ'}). Neither the tag keys nor the tag values will be modified by this module.

snippets.content: { for k, v in merge(local.tags, lookup(|DATA_SINK|, "tags", {})) : k => v if k != "Name" }
snippets.title: Override

sections.title: tags

sections.description:
ID element _(Rarely used, not included by default)_.

A customer identifier, indicating who this instance of a resource is for
sections.title: tenant

sections.description:
Throughput mode for the file system.

Defaults to bursting.

Valid values: `bursting`, `provisioned`.

When using `provisioned`, also set `provisioned_throughput_in_mibps`
sections.title: throughput_mode

sections.description:
Indicates how long it takes to transition files to the Infrequent Access (IA) storage class.

Valid values: AFTER_7_DAYS, AFTER_14_DAYS, AFTER_30_DAYS, AFTER_60_DAYS and AFTER_90_DAYS.

Default (no value) means \"never\".
sections.title: transition_to_ia

sections.description:
Describes the policy used to transition a file from Infrequent Access (IA) storage to primary storage.

Valid values: AFTER_1_ACCESS.
sections.title: transition_to_primary_storage_class

sections.description: VPC ID
sections.title: vpc_id

sections.description:
Route53 DNS Zone ID as list of string (0 or 1 items).

If empty, no custom DNS name will be published.

If the list contains a single Zone ID, a custom DNS name will be pulished in that zone.

Can also be a plain string, but that use is DEPRECATED because of Terraform issues.
sections.title: zone_id

efs_filesystems.title: Configuration

s3_buckets.description:
Creates an S3 bucket with support for versioning, lifecycles, object locks, replication, encryption, ACL, bucket object policies, and static website hosting Builds the resources(s) from terraform-aws-s3-bucket/3.1.1 This is done by adding a declaration for the desired asset in ../config/infrastructure/s3_buckets.yaml. Each parameter may or may not contain any of the following:
Default
Either a default value or a generator used to produce a default value using Terraform
Override
A value or generator that always overrides any value set
Required
Whether the parameter must be set or not
Type
The type of the parameter as dictated by Terraform's types and values documentation
Use the parameters to construct the specification for your asset.

sections.description: Set to `true` to create an IAM Access Key for the created IAM user
sections.title: access_key_enabled

sections.description: Account ID for the module instance
sections.title: account_id

sections.description: AWS accounts where the module instance will be built
sections.title: accounts

sections.description:
The [canned ACL](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/acl-overview.html#canned-acl) to apply.

Deprecated by AWS in favor of bucket policies.

Automatically disabled if `s3_object_ownership` is set to "BucketOwnerEnforced".

Defaults to "private" for backwards compatibility, but we recommend setting `s3_object_ownership` to "BucketOwnerEnforced" instead.
sections.title: acl

sections.description:
Additional key-value pairs to add to each map in `tags_as_list_of_maps`.

Not added to `tags` or `id`.

This is for some rare cases where resources want additional configuration of tags

and therefore take a list of maps with tag key, value, and additional configuration.
sections.title: additional_tag_map

sections.description: Set to `true` to prevent uploads of unencrypted objects to S3 bucket
sections.title: allow_encrypted_uploads_only

sections.description:
Set to `true` to require requests to use Secure Socket Layer (HTTPS/SSL).

This will explicitly deny access to HTTP requests
sections.title: allow_ssl_requests_only

sections.description: List of actions the user is permitted to perform on the S3 bucket
sections.title: allowed_bucket_actions

sections.description:
ID element.

Additional attributes (e.g. `workers` or `cluster`) to add to `id`,

in the order they appear in the list.

New attributes are appended to the

end of the list.

The elements of the list are joined by the `delimiter`

and treated as a single ID element.
sections.title: attributes

sections.description: Set to `false` to disable the blocking of new public access lists on the bucket
sections.title: block_public_acls

sections.description: Set to `false` to disable the blocking of new public policies on the bucket
sections.title: block_public_policy

sections.description:
Set this to true to use Amazon S3 Bucket Keys for SSE-KMS, which may reduce the number of AWS KMS requests.

For more information, see: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/userguide/bucket-key.html
sections.title: bucket_key_enabled

sections.description:
Bucket name.

If provided, the bucket will be created with this name instead of generating the name from the context
sections.title: bucket_name

sections.description: Specifies the allowed headers, methods, origins and exposed headers when using CORS on this bucket

snippets.content:
optional(list(object({
allowed_headers = optional(list(string))
allowed_methods = optional(list(string))
allowed_origins = optional(list(string))
expose_headers = optional(list(string))
max_age_seconds = optional(number)
})))
snippets.title: Type

sections.title: cors_configuration

sections.description:
Delimiter to be used between ID elements.

Defaults to `-` (hyphen).

Set to `""` to use no delimiter at all.
sections.title: delimiter

sections.description: Whether to enable a Kinesis delivery stream firehose or not
sections.title: delivery_stream

sections.description: Describe additional descriptors to be output in the `descriptors` output map. Map of maps. Keys are names of descriptors. Values are maps of the form { format = string labels = list(string) } (Type is `any` so the map values can later be enhanced to provide additional options.) `format` is a Terraform format string to be passed to the `format()` function. `labels` is a list of labels, in order, to pass to `format()` function. Label values will be normalized before being passed to `format()` so they will be identical to how they appear in `id`. Default is {} (`descriptors` output will be empty).
sections.title: descriptor_formats

sections.description: Set to false to prevent the module from creating any resources
sections.title: enabled

sections.description:
ID element.

Usually used for region e.g. 'uw2', 'us-west-2', OR role 'prod', 'staging', 'dev', 'UAT'
sections.title: environment

sections.description: Execution role ARN for the module instance
sections.title: execution_role_arn

sections.description:
Extra grants for the bucket.

Must specify a type and permission.
sections.title: extra_grants

sections.description:
When `true`, permits a non-empty S3 bucket to be deleted by first deleting all objects in the bucket.

THESE OBJECTS ARE NOT RECOVERABLE even if they were versioned and stored in Glacier.
sections.title: force_destroy

sections.description: Whether to grant the organization access to the bucket
sections.title: grant_organization_access

sections.description:
A list of policy grants for the bucket, taking a list of permissions.

Conflicts with `acl`.

Set `acl` to `null` to use this.

Deprecated by AWS in favor of bucket policies.

Automatically disabled if `s3_object_ownership` is set to "BucketOwnerEnforced".

snippets.title: Type

sections.title: grants

sections.description:
Limit `id` to this many characters (minimum 6).

Set to `0` for unlimited length.

Set to `null` for keep the existing setting, which defaults to `0`.

Does not affect `id_full`.
sections.title: id_length_limit

sections.description: Set to `false` to disable the ignoring of public access lists on the bucket
sections.title: ignore_public_acls

sections.description:
The AWS KMS master key ARN used for the `SSE-KMS` encryption.

This can only be used when you set the value of `sse_algorithm` as `aws:kms`.

The default aws/s3 AWS KMS master key is used if this element is absent while the `sse_algorithm` is `aws:kms`
sections.title: kms_master_key_arn

sections.description:
The order in which the labels (ID elements) appear in the `id`.

Defaults to ["namespace", "environment", "stage", "name", "attributes"].

You can omit any of the 6 labels ("tenant" is the 6th), but at least one must be present.
sections.title: label_order

sections.description: Bucket access logging configuration.
sections.title: logging

sections.description: Whether to manage the S3 bucket or treat it as a reference to an unmanaged existing bucket
sections.title: managed

sections.description: Specify a maximum number of days for data to live in the bucket
sections.title: max_days

sections.description: Specify a maximum number of days for noncurrent data to live in the bucket
sections.title: max_noncurrent_days

sections.description: Specify a maximum number of noncurrent versions to live in the bucket
sections.title: max_noncurrent_versions

sections.description:
ID element.

Usually the component or solution name, e.g. 'app' or 'jenkins'.

This is the only ID element not also included as a `tag`.

The "name" tag is set to the full `id` string.

There is no tag with the value of the `name` input.
sections.title: name

sections.description:
ID element.

Usually an abbreviation of your organization name, e.g. 'eg' or 'cp', to help ensure generated IDs are globally unique
sections.title: namespace

sections.description:
Optional map of accounts to a corresponding spoke VPC network name within the account.

Use the network name from the Transit Gateway, not the VPC name itself, e.g. cluster_Clusters_Prod.
sections.title: network_map

sections.description: Specify a maximum number of days after which data will transition to another class
sections.title: noncurrent_transition_after

sections.description: Specify a data class for noncurrent versions to transition to
sections.title: noncurrent_transition_to

sections.description:
A configuration for S3 object locking.

With S3 Object Lock, you can store objects using a `write once, read many` (WORM) model.

Object Lock can help prevent objects from being deleted or overwritten for a fixed amount of time or indefinitely.

snippets.title: Type

sections.title: object_lock_configuration

sections.description: Whether to build an instance of the module for private Intranet access
sections.title: private

sections.description: List of actions to permit `privileged_principal_arns` to perform on bucket and bucket prefixes (see `privileged_principal_arns`)
sections.title: privileged_principal_actions

sections.description:
List of maps.

Each map has a key, an IAM Principal ARN, whose associated value is

a list of S3 path prefixes to grant `privileged_principal_actions` permissions for that principal,

in addition to the bucket itself, which is automatically included.

Prefixes should not begin with '/'.
sections.title: privileged_principal_arns

sections.description: Whether to build an instance of the module for public Internet access
sections.title: public

sections.description:
Terraform regular expression (regex) string.

Characters matching the regex will be removed from the ID elements.

If not set, `"/[^a-zA-Z0-9-]/"` is used to remove all characters other than hyphens, letters and digits.
sections.title: regex_replace_chars

sections.description: Set to `false` to disable the restricting of making the bucket public
sections.title: restrict_public_buckets

sections.description:
Specifies the S3 object ownership control.

Valid values are `ObjectWriter`, `BucketOwnerPreferred`, and 'BucketOwnerEnforced'.

Defaults to "ObjectWriter" for backwards compatibility, but we recommend setting "BucketOwnerEnforced" instead.
sections.title: s3_object_ownership

sections.description:
A single S3 bucket ARN to use for all replication rules.

Note: The destination bucket can be specified in the replication rule itself

(which allows for multiple destinations), in which case it will take precedence over this variable.
sections.title: s3_replica_bucket_arn

sections.description:
Set this to true and specify `s3_replication_rules` to enable replication.

`versioning_enabled` must also be `true`.
sections.title: s3_replication_enabled

sections.description: Permissions boundary ARN for the created IAM replication role.
sections.title: s3_replication_permissions_boundary_arn

sections.description:
Specifies the replication rules for S3 bucket replication if enabled.

You must also set s3_replication_enabled to true.
sections.title: s3_replication_rules

sections.description: Cross-account IAM Role ARNs that will be allowed to perform S3 replication to this bucket (for replication within the same AWS account, it's not necessary to adjust the bucket policy).
sections.title: s3_replication_source_roles

sections.description: Whether if organization access is granted to skip the actual grants
sections.title: skip_grants

sections.description:
List of IAM policy documents that are merged together into the exported document.

Statements defined in source_policy_documents or source_json must have unique SIDs.

Statement having SIDs that match policy SIDs generated by this module will override them.
sections.title: source_policy_documents

sections.description:
The server-side encryption algorithm to use.

Valid values are `AES256` and `aws:kms`
sections.title: sse_algorithm

sections.description: The base path for SSM parameters where created IAM user's access key is stored
sections.title: ssm_base_path

sections.description:
ID element.

Usually used to indicate role, e.g. 'prod', 'staging', 'source', 'build', 'test', 'deploy', 'release'
sections.title: stage

sections.description:
Set to `true` to store the created IAM user's access key in SSM Parameter Store,

`false` to store them in Terraform state as outputs.

Since Terraform state would contain the secrets in plaintext,

use of SSM Parameter Store is recommended.
sections.title: store_access_key_in_ssm

sections.description: Additional tags (e.g. {'BusinessUnit': 'XYZ'}). Neither the tag keys nor the tag values will be modified by this module.

snippets.content: { for k, v in merge(local.tags, lookup(|DATA_SINK|, "tags", {})) : k => v if k != "Name" }
snippets.title: Override

sections.title: tags

sections.description:
ID element _(Rarely used, not included by default)_.

A customer identifier, indicating who this instance of a resource is for
sections.title: tenant

sections.description:
Set this to `true` to enable S3 Transfer Acceleration for the bucket.

Note: When this is set to `false` Terraform does not perform drift detection

and will not disable Transfer Acceleration if it was enabled outside of Terraform.

To disable it via Terraform, you must set this to `true` and then to `false`.

Note: not all regions support Transfer Acceleration.
sections.title: transfer_acceleration_enabled

sections.description: Specify a maximum number of days after which data will transition to another class
sections.title: transition_after

sections.description: Specify a data class to transition to
sections.title: transition_to

sections.description: Set to `true` to create an IAM user with permission to access the bucket
sections.title: user_enabled

sections.description: Permission boundary ARN for the IAM user created to access the bucket.
sections.title: user_permissions_boundary_arn

sections.description:
A state of versioning.

Versioning is a means of keeping multiple variants of an object in the same bucket
sections.title: versioning_enabled

sections.description: Specifies the static website hosting configuration object
sections.title: website_configuration

sections.description: If provided, all website requests will be redirected to the specified host name and protocol
sections.title: website_redirect_all_requests_to
